newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Renaissance retains buy on Mosenergo.
newsitem.headline: Renaissance retains buy on Mosenergo.

text.p: Renaissance Capital said it was reiterating its "buy" recommendation on Mosenergo, the main electric power provider for the Moscow region, saying it had good prospects for development and profitability.

"Given the Moscow city government's record for allowing fairly realistic tariffs, it is highly likely Mosenergo will be able to continue to provide good returns to investors," the Moscow investment bank said in a research note.

Mosenergo is gradually raising tariffs charged to residential customers, its most reliable payers. It plans to hike them by about 30 percent this spring, making residential sales 20 percent of the total, and eventually bring residential tariffs to production costs plus five percent.
But at the same time tariffs charged to industry will fall in real terms in 1997.
OAO Energetiki i Elektrifikatsii Mosenergo will issue accounts to International Accounting Standards before a planned Eurobond in mid-1997, Renaissance noted.
Capital expenditure is planned to run at $500 million a year for the next few years.
Foreign investors own 35 percent of Mosenergo, and national power company UES owns 49 percent.
At 1020 GMT Mosenergo was $1.431, up from $1.415 at Wednesday's close.
